book.book_title: THE FIRST LETTER OF PAUL TO THE CORINTHIANS
book.title: Greeting
Thanksgiving for the Corinthian Believers
book.note: Some manuscripts have "to the church of God that is in Corinth, sanctified in Christ Jesus"
book.title: Divisions in the Church at Corinth
Christ Crucified, the Power and Wisdom of God
book.note: Some manuscripts have "I give thanks to God"
book.title: Boast in the Lord
Paul's Approach to Ministry in Corinth
The Wisdom Revealed by the Spirit
book.note: Some manuscripts have "But to us God has revealed them"
book.title: Divisiveness and Immaturity
book.note: That is, like people who do not possess the Spirit at all
book.title: Christ's Servant, God's Steward
The Apostles' Humility
Paul's Concern for the Corinthian Believers
Immoral Behavior and Church Discipline
Lawsuits between Believers
Avoid Sexual Immorality
book.note: Some manuscripts have "of the Lord Jesus Christ"
book.title: Concerning Christian Marriage
book.note: i.e., in the sense of "have sexual relations with"
book.title: Concerning the Unmarried
book.note: Or "if his passions are strong" (it is not clear in context whether this term refers to the man or to the woman)
Or perhaps "the one who gives in marriage"
book.title: Concerning Food Sacrificed to Idols
book.note: Considered by many interpreters to be a slogan used by the Corinthians to justify their behavior
Considered by many interpreters to be slogans used by the Corinthians to justify their behavior
Some manuscripts omit "For" and have "Neither if we do not eat do we lack, nor if we do eat do we have more"
book.title: Paul Gives Up His Rights as an Apostle
A History Lesson from Israel
Warning Against Idolatry
Freedom in Christ
book.note: A quotation from Ps 24:1, and an allusion to Ps 50:12; 89:11
book.title: Concerning Head Coverings in Worship
Improper Conduct at the Lord's Supper
book.note: Some manuscripts have "is given to her"
book.title: Varieties of Spiritual Gifts
book.note: Or "spiritual things"; possibly "those who possess spiritual gifts"
book.title: Unity in the Midst of Diversity
Love, the More Excellent Way
book.note: Some manuscripts have "in order that I may boast"
Lit. "does not seek the things of itself"
book.title: Appropriate Use of Prophecy and Tongues
book.note: Or "in the Spirit"; or "in his spirit"
book.title: Specific Instructions for Orderly Worship Services
book.note: Or "or one who possesses the Spirit"
Some manuscripts have "are a command of the Lord"
Or "if anyone is ignorant, let him be ignorant"
book.title: Paul's Gospel and the Resurrection of Christ
Concerning the Resurrection of the Dead
book.note: Lit. "we are having put our hope"
Some manuscripts have "also will be subjected"
book.title: Questions Concerning the Resurrection Body
book.note: A quotation from the Greek poet Menander's comedy Thais, 218
book.title: Concerning the Collection for the Saints
Travel Plans for Paul and Associates
book.note: Lit. "whatever if anything he has been prospered"
book.title: Concluding Exhortations
Final Greetings and Benediction
book.note: That is, the Roman province of Asia, known today as Asia Minor
The Aramaic expression marana tha ("O Lord, come!") can also be rendered maran atha ("our Lord has come"); it is used here by Paul without explanation
